result.execSummary:
The defendant Shykeia Monique Sims was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable court costs and fees, including DNA surcharges by 5/16/16, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: to any other sentence. STRAIGHT TIME.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shykeia Monique Sims

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court ordered defendant to serve 15 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for zero days time served, STRAIGHT TIME.  

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and fees, including DNA surcharges by 5/16/16, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Defendant Shykeia Monique Sims in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Shykeia Monique Sims in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Shykeia Monique Sims not in court, in custody.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for Plea/Sentencing Hearing. Court unable to hear case on this date. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Shykeia Monique Sims not in court, in custody and not produced.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea. Court is in jury trial for today's proceedings.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Shykeia Monique Sims not in court, in custody and not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Pre-trial conference held off the record.   Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ALL Kmarts in Milwaukee County

Defendant Shykeia Monique Sims in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Shykeia Monique Sims in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
